new-project-p: Projects are unique groups of addresses used for deploying and managing your vaults.
new-project-governance:
Your project's governance addresses 
 has full control over vaults created from this project (ie rugging power)
new-project-management: Your project's management addresses has less authorization and is meant for day-to-day operations. Providing a management address is recommended but optional and cannot be the same as your governance address.
new-vault-min-change: To start adding strategies to your vault, set a minimum change greater than 0. Minimum Change sets the minimum deposit needed to update a strategy's debt. Deposits below this threshold remain idle until enough funds accumulate—saving gas fees. For more guidance, ask on a Yearn-approved channel.
new-vault-accept-fee-manager: Your address, {0}, has been set as this vault's fee manager, but you must accept first!
minimum-change: Minimum Change sets the minimum deposit needed to update a strategy's debt. Deposits below this threshold remain idle until enough funds accumulate—saving gas fees.
target-debt-ratio: Target Debt Ratio is the desired allocation of the vault's assets this strategy should be lent at any given time, adjusted for gains or losses.
effective-debt-ratio: Effective Debt Ratio is the percentage of the vault's total assets currently held by this strategy adjusted for gains or losses.
max-debt: Max Debt is the maximum amount of assets this strategy can borrow from the vault. For most strategies we recommend MAX (unlimited) for max debt. For high risk strategies max debt is used as a safety mechanism.
strategy-queue: The Strategy Queue defines the default order in which strategies are called during withdrawals and auto-allocations. When a user withdraws funds, the vault attempts to pull assets from strategies in this order until the withdrawal is satisfied. When the vault auto-allocates idle funds, it deposits into strategies following this same order.
use-default-queue: When enabled, the vault will always use the default strategy queue for withdrawals, regardless of any custom withdrawal queue passed by users. This ensures consistent withdrawal ordering and prevents users from bypassing the vault's intended strategy priority.
auto-allocate: When enabled, the vault automatically allocates idle funds to strategies whenever a deposit occurs. Deposits are distributed to strategies following the default queue order, up to each strategy's target debt allocation. When disabled, deposited funds remain idle in the vault until manually allocated by the debt manager.
